p: Mauritia flexuosa is one of the most interesting palm trees in Brazil, common in the Pará, Amazonas, Amapá, Rondônia, Goiás, Distrito Federal, Bahia, Minas Gerais, Mato Grosso, Ceará, and Maranhão states. The fruit has diverse purposes, with the pulp being used in ice creams, jams, creams, jellies, liqueurs, and vitamins [ 7]. This palm tree is also used for edible oil extraction and its nutritional worth varies with seasonality and the extraction process [ 8].
